contact.org: South Central Community FSC Ltd
contact.name: Nurhidayah Binte Sazali

name: Cleaning and Anti-Mould Supplies
description:
Background:
Madam K is a devoted mother caring for her two children, both of whom are managing eczema, a chronic skin condition that requires careful environmental control. She herself also experiences eczema flare-ups, which makes daily household maintenance especially challenging.
Current Situation:
Due to persistent mould growth in the bathroom, Madam K has found it increasingly difficult to maintain a clean and safe environment without triggering skin irritation for herself and her children. The family’s eczema symptoms tend to worsen when exposed to mould and harsh cleaning chemicals. This creates a cycle of discomfort and stress for both mother and children.

Need:
To maintain a clean, skin-safe environment, Madam K requires:
• Gentle, eczema-friendly cleaning materials (e.g., non-fragranced detergents, gloves, mild surface cleaners)
• Anti-mould products suitable for sensitive skin environments

Intended Outcome:
With these supplies and supports, Madam K will be able to:
• Reduce mould and allergen exposure in the home
• Minimise eczema flare-ups for herself and her children
• Improve the family’s comfort, sleep quality, and overall well-being
• Foster a healthier living environment conducive to long-term skin management

Request:
We seek donor support to provide:
• Anti-mould and eczema-safe cleaning products(for toilet)
• Replacement of cleaning tools (e.g., gloves, mop heads, gentle disinfectants)

Closing Statement:
Your contribution will directly improve this family’s living conditions and health. By reducing exposure to mould and harsh chemicals, you will help Madam K and her children experience relief from daily discomfort — and create a cleaner, safer home where they can focus on healing and growing together.

contact.org: NTUC Health Co-operative Limited
contact.name: Audrina Tan

name: Blood Glucose Machine
description:
Background:
Madam S is a resilient single mother who is currently managing multiple chronic conditions — hypertension, Type II diabetes, and chronic kidney disease (CKD) requiring dialysis three times a week. Despite her health challenges, she continues to support her children, ensuring their daily needs are met and that they remain under stable care.

Current Situation:
Madam S works 2 to 4 days a week, on alternating day (9 a.m. – 9 p.m.) and night (9 p.m. – 9 a.m.) shifts, to provide for her family. Her irregular working hours and ongoing dialysis treatments significantly limit her income and physical stamina. She has no regular partner support and relies mainly on her own effort, with occasional help from friends and relatives who assist in caring for her children during her dialysis sessions and work shifts.

Need:
A blood glucose monitoring machine would greatly support Madam S in managing her diabetes more effectively between dialysis sessions. Currently, she does not have a reliable way to monitor her blood sugar levels at home, which puts her at higher risk for hypoglycemic or hyperglycemic episodes.

Intended Outcome:
With access to a blood glucose monitor and test strips, Madam S will be able to:
• Track her blood sugar levels regularly and adjust her diet or medication accordingly.
• Better manage her condition, reducing complications and hospital admissions.
• Maintain stability for her children through improved health and fewer medical disruptions.

Request:
We seek support to provide:
• One (1) blood glucose monitoring device
• Lancets and test strips (minimum 6 months’ supply)
• Alcohol wipes

Closing Statement:
Madam S exemplifies quiet strength and determination in the face of chronic illness and caregiving responsibilities. Your contribution will not only meet an immediate medical need but also affirm her effort to remain a caring and self-reliant mother despite the challenges she faces.
